Articles.Content:
Anyone up for round two?

Staying up late again. Fell asleep during the first attempt.

Just pulled this from the blog:

Liquid oxygen is being pumped into the Delta IV HeavyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s three core boosters. The RS-68A engines, one at the base of each booster core, burn liquid hydrogen and oxygen to produce the thrust needed to lift Orion off the launch pad and start it on its way to orbit. The second stage, which is also beginning to be filled with propellant, uses the same combination of hydrogen and oxygen though not nearly as much as the first stages use.

If this launch doesn't happen then they have to wait until Sunday for a third attempt.

Anyone up for round two?

Yep! Standing by with fingers crossed. Just tuned into NASA live and it looks awesome sitting there in the spot lights.

Yep! Standing by with fingers crossed. Just tuned into NASA live and it looks awesome sitting there in the spot lights.

Hello Fellow Imgurian, thank you for the invite to the forum.....

I have to say I'm pretty excited for this launch, ever since I saw the Orion capsule in Houston last year....

Hello Fellow Imgurian, thank you for the invite to the forum.....

I have to say I'm pretty excited for this launch, ever since I saw the Orion capsule in Houston last year....

Welcome aboard! Yeah v excited too, really hope we get a launch today.
15 min built in hold started
I would love to see it launch perfectly today with no issues at all:P

"all systems are go and weather remains green"

< 11mins to launch!!
YAY! thou shalt not tripp false alarms this time
Inb4 a boat drives into the safe area...
Everything looks good! 5 minutes

Inb4 a boat drives into the safe area...

omg, if that happens again they should just blow the boat up.

Good service panel jett, Launch Abort System jett. Everything going very well.
